title: The Open House
summary: Following a tragedy, a teenager (Dylan Minnette) and his mother (Piercey Dalton) move to a relative's vacant vacation home, where eerie and unexplained forces conspire against them.

reviews.content: A decently entertaining first two acts are ruined by a terrible third act. It makes the whole movie pointless and everything is left unexplained and unanswered.

I think the biggest problem is that the writers had no idea what type of horror movie they were making and never really resolved it: it's an ineffective ghost/haunting film, hints at being a film about a mentally ill neighbour, but ends up just being an ineffective implacable serial killer film.   There's also plenty of elements which are introduced, have no effect on the story and then fade away e.g. Martha.

Even if you’ve never heard of the Open House, you’re still thinking of the Open House. The writing is bad and the plot stupid, uninspired and worse, boring. With the exception of Piercey Dalton as Naomi, the acting is bad, especially by the star, Dylan Minnette, of 13 Reasons Why fame. There are some nice shots, but this, like all of the positives in this film, is overshadowed by the overall experience which is that of boredom and little scares.
